The Growth Newsletter #096 - Demand Curve

## About
- Author: [[Demand Curve|Demand Curve]]
- Full Title: The Growth Newsletter #096

## My Highlights
> 1. Use Google Docs for promos to create urgency ⏱
\-  ([View Highlight](https://read.readwise.io/read/01gt9mym1wzmmx7a935kcx0q36))

> We didn't use a landing page. Instead, we used a [Google Doc](http://email.demandcurve.) that pitched the course and used a Stripe payment link for checkout.
> We primarily did this for two reasons. To create urgency, and it's simple:
> ![](https://userimg-bee.customeriomail.com/images/client-env-95156/image%20%2873%29.png)
\-  ([View Highlight](https://read.readwise.io/read/01gt9myz4j7kx0vxmhmshq5xra))

> We didn't use a landing page. Instead, we used a [Google Doc](http://email.demandcurve.) that pitched the course and used a Stripe payment link for checkout.
> We primarily did this for two reasons. To create urgency, and it's simple:
> ![](https://userimg-bee.customeriomail.com/images/client-env-95156/image%20%2873%29.png)
> Visitors could see that 90 other people were looking at that page when there were only 30 remaining spots.
\-  ([View Highlight](https://read.readwise.io/read/01gt9mzmz41qmhjxambvvncj9j))

> The best campaigns message users where they’re most active. And where the message is most relevant. Whether that’s email, SMS, in-app messages, or push notifications.
> For example, well-timed and relevant push notifications are hard to ignore. Use them to re-engage customers and reduce churn.
> In-app messages sent to active users can help onboard them, get them to use a new feature, or push them to upgrade to a higher tier to unlock something they’re trying to use.
\-  ([View Highlight](https://read.readwise.io/read/01gt9n2c4z32sey3fzg6t2jyf5))
